author: Kaden Tift
comment: Fun fact: these are called Lycan wolves because a lycan wolf is a person who turns into a Humanoid wolf while a werewolf is a person who turns into a normal wolf.

author: Kaden Tift
comment: @The Wayward Son I was just trying to to give some cool facts

author: The Wayward Son
comment: @Kaden Tift It is not a fact. What you mentioned is a piece from the origin of the werewolf mythology. A piece! Many cultures, in several places of the globe, have a myth of a human turning into a wolf. I'm not going to go into history, since I don't even know much about the mythology. The thing is, with the arrival of cinema and pop culture, this type of werewolf ended up becoming a trend.  This transformation from man to wolf, although it may have received other names and forms centuries or millennia ago, it ended up changing with culture. Moral of the story, one name does not exclude the other, it is an imaginary creature, and its name depends only on the creator of the story and the people who read it. Most see the creature above as a werewolf, so it's a werewolf, but the creator names it shapshifter, so in the story above it's a shapshifter, but the two names don't have to exclude each other.

author: Cassandra Morris
comment: THE CHANNEL DIES IN A WEEK (allegedly)  Damn. Here we are again. This morning I woke up to a dozen old copyright claims being filed. As a result, having 3+ copyright strikes has my channel marked for deletion in a week. I'm waiting on responses from folks right now to try and get this resolved, but honestly I'm less than hopeful. As if I needed more reasons to stay away from Youtube, right? I'm going to lose everything if this channel goes away, but I'm sure as hell not going to lose this incredible audience and community I've created over these last 3 years - some of the best years of my life. I owe all of this to all of you, the folks who keep coming back just to see what I've been up to, or message me encouraging things when I'm not feeling 100%. I love you all, each and every one of you. Well, everyone but Phil. Sorry, Phil.

comment: You can't do any of that, technically he himself couldn't have left. That would be going AWOL, a punishable offense under UCMJ with brig time or worse depending on the scenario. You can't just abandon your assigned post. This entire episode of Love Death and Robots is filled with inaccuracies about the Marine Corps. Even the way they got treated makes no sense, we the Marine Corps are beyond a close family, no matter our differences.  Evidence of how I know all this? Because I'm a fucking Marine.

author: Talis17118
comment: @John King true and it would be a sight

author: John King
comment: @Talis17118 Agreed on the jealousy thing; really well written.   Though, I still can't help wondering: isn't there at least one soldier who could've thought, A marine werewolf that can tear apart anyone that looks at them wrong? I'd really want that guy backing me up; not just as a fellow soldier, but as a friend. Maybe I should be nicer to them; give them an actual reason to want to defend me and my people, and not just because it's their job.   People fight harder for their friends, and it just feels a little sad that none of the soldiers tried to really befriend the two werewolves. Sobieski (the best friend who dies) at least seemed friendly enough until the officer pissed him off. And without Sobieski there, Decker literally only stayed around long enough to get revenge, then ran off.  Then again, people have always been afraid of things that are more powerful than them. And for some reason, anger and hate is always our go-to cover for fear.  Imagine a story where everyone was terrified of a secretly supernatural creature, but instead of openly hating it, they tried being extra friendly to it? Wouldn't that be a sight?

author: Sarah Hammond
comment: @Talis17118 Bloody well said. You should write a book....seriously

author: Talis17118
comment: Jealousy is part of it... no soldier wants to feel phased out for something that is blatantly better than them... in their human form they can out lift, out run, and out endure any trained human soldier. Now, give that werewolf military training to increase their already immense physical attributes and tactics that puts method to the ripping and tearing. A werewolf in his changed form carrying an LMG or some other firearm opening up from a place they never expected something to attack from is the stuff of nightmares in some well done werewolf fan stories. Now have a good size pack, lets say a probable standard of 5: The Alpha, Beta, 2 Grunts/Underlings, and the Omega/Scout (because he drew the short straw); one team of organized paramilitary werewolves is a national crisis from anyone that has to flush them out, a devilish nightmare for the countries that can't field werewolves to even the odds. Werewolves in most respects are force multipliers; if you are really fucked up in training them, teach them that when they are desperate need of food and water and it can't be air dropped.. eat the enemy and take their water.

author: daniel beck
comment: Honestly there are number of episodes that deserve their own series.  Sonnie's Edge (A prequel to how she became the what she was would be interesting.)  Shape-Shifters (Can go with a prequel and/or aftermath of some sort. Definitely has potential in either direction.)  Good Hunting (Might see how the relationship of the two main characters might evolve.)  Lucky 13 (Honestly it looked there was way more going on background wise that seemed intriguing. Would like to see a story of that pilot describing more of that world.)  The Secret War (I seriously am curious as to how that how came to be, I get technically there is a bit of a that dropped. But say during whatever conflict drove someone to summon demons. To put an example out of what I mean think of the first Resistance game for PS3. It did showed a bit of lore and backstory to describe what was kind of happening before we enter Europe. And honestly, would like to a resurgence of those creatures. Put it simply they're demons, yeah they bombed the hell out of them. But truthfully you think they got them all? They did burrow in the mountain side, whose not to say they had more burrows and/or extensive tunnel network else where. And again demons, can kill with modern firearm, but don't think it's enough to ensure they don't comeback in some other manner. Would probably take something a bit more on the holy side or something. That or to recover whatever relic to help in a counter-ritual to banish them for good.)

author: Unknown Source
comment: This show is SOOOOOO FUCKING DOPE!!!! But damn is this SONG SHITTY AF!!! Seriously this song and the band that made it are so fucking lame!!! Like, why are there such terrible bands making such horrible music. Do they think these lyrics are cool? Ultra cheesy ass lyrics. I laugh at whoever listens to this type of music and takes it seriously or feels empowered by it. Like the amount of passion and effort and time that these animators have put into making this absolutely phenominal animated short films with such style compared to this cheesy, cookie-cutter, downright awful piece of trash song that this talentless group of losers that call themselves musicians have made is no contest. It makes me sick that someone would take this atrocity that tasteless individuals would call a good song or good music, and layer it over such a well defined and refined work of magic that these amazing animators have created. It really makes me want to hurt someone!!! Like fuck, i feel sooooo flabbergasted and even disrespected that someone tied some piece of shit song to such an awesome piece of work that is this video. I hate seeing shit like this on the internet, and its full of stuff like this. Like how could people have so distasteful!! Such a disgrace!!!! Does anyone feel me on this?? FUCK!!!!

author: el mono
comment: @Utkarsh Srivastava Love, Death & Robots - a science fiction horror anthology created as both a spiritual successor and reimagining of the 1981 animated cult classic; Heavy Metal. It has a collection of stand alone science fiction short stories done in different art styles (except one is done in live action), each unique and diverse from another. It is very good show on Netflix but as a fare warning, this is one of the darkest, most demented, and extremely fucked up series on Netflix. This adult anthology series includes blood & gore, intense violence, strong language, sex, nudity, explicit torture, and disturbing images. Luckily there are a few light hearted episodes like my favorite episode, 3 Robots which is pretty funny (I haven't seen foul mouthed, funny robots since Bender from Futurama and the ones from the Mystery Science Theater 3000). Overall, I highly recommend it, as long as you can handle it's grim and grizzly details. Also do not watch this in front of anybody under the age of 18 as this show can traumatize younger viewers.

author: My Life
comment: He and his bud are werewolves who were hired by the marines to fight other werewolves and to protect them. The other marines hated their guts because of who they are, but they always had each others back. Later on, his bud got assigned to another camp, but on that same night, there were shootings at that camp and he went to go check. He soon found out that his bud got killed by a werewolf. It was a tactical kill too as he figured out that his buddy was the first one killed. I guess the next day, or so it seemed, he went on to scout the village with fellow marines and he figured out who the werewolf was by smell. Later on the evening, night time, he went to where the werewolf was and fought that bitch. He didnt know that there was another one. Anyways he won. He returned back injured. He quit the marines and carried his friend away to give him a proper burial. He doesn't die.  The story tells that of respect, honor, loyalty, compassion, and how those things should be held above all else, even death!  Edit: the clip basically summed up everything.

author: RocRolWriter
comment: Write it anyway; just figure out how to put your own spin on it.  I read somewhere that if something's 25% different or more from something else, it's different enough to not get copyrighted even if the base idea is the same. True originality is rare nowadays; sometimes it feels like everything has been done before.  Focus too hard on trying to make something original and you start to lose out on good - or it takes too long to make and you miss your chance.  Just focus on making it good first, then on differentiating it from things you _know_ have the same idea, and then put a any similarity to other works is unintentional to cover things with the same idea that you don't know.

author: Gillian Robinson
comment: This episode of Love, Death, and Robots really capitalizes how an honorable American soldier who just happens to be a werewolf decides to ignore his superiors to bring in the wolf that killed so many other soldiers alive and do what his instincts/guts know to avenge the death of his beloved brother in arms as we see that there were two other â€wolvesâ€ in the area near where the base was. This lone werewolf we were following killed both of them, almost barely making it out alive! This was a touching episode and to see an animated American soldier as a werewolf fighting the honorable fight was somehow satisfying to me. Even the ending was honorable to me in a way. Not sure if anyone else thought that, or if it was just me. Loved the video!!! Keep it up!!!!!!
